chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Marie C. Fritsch was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 01-26-2016 to reflect the correct alcohol concentration enhancer statute of 346.65(2)(g)1 and to delete the 6 month stay of defendant's 1 year conditional jail time.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence being served.
AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Credit for 72 days, if probation is revoked.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations including establishment of a Driver Safety Plan.

timeConds.notes:
6 months stayed.
Defendant granted good time credit.
**Amended 01-26-2016 to delete the 6 month stay of defendant's 1 year conditional jail time.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
A.D.A. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Atty. Genelle Johnson.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 of the amended information (OWI 5th, with minor passenger). Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty as to Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed.   (.266)
Statements by counsel.
Victim impact statement provided to the Court.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence being served.  Conditions:  1)  Pay all costs and fees, 2) Pay a fine of $1200.00 plus costs, which includes all fees and BDF, for a total of $2544.50  3)  Undergo AODA and drivers safety plan, 4)  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol, must maintain absolute sobriety  5)  3 year drivers license revocation, with credit,  equip vehicles with IID for a period of 3 years,  6) serve one year in jail, with good time and huber privileges -- 6 months stayed. 7) Complete 40 hours of community service.
If revoked, defendant is entitled to 72 days of credit.
Appeal rights, firearms and voting restrictions were provided.
Status conference at 11-10-2015 02:00 pm
call from defense counsel would like to continue until after defendant sentenced in Winnebago Co
